section.title: Time measurement
section.para: Time measurement during a test can be very helpful. You can use the action <traceTime> for this purpose. This action should be placed several times into the action chain. The action offers the attribute "id" to identify a time line. This enables the tester to use more than one time measurements at the same time. If you leave out the id the action offers a default id as you can see here in the first action reference.
section.programlisting:
<testcase name="timeWatcherTest_new"> <actions> <traceTime/>
<traceTime id="time_line_id"/>
<sleep time="3.5"/>
<traceTime id=" time_line_id "/>
<sleep time="5.0"/>
<traceTime/>
<traceTime id=" time_line_id "/> </actions> </testcase>
section.para: To print out the current elapsed time for a time line you simply have to place the <traceTime> action into the action chain again, using the respective id. The elapsed time will be printed out to the console.
